CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, August 12, 1961, pg. 1 reads: "Boycott Wins! Negroes to Sit All Over Roanoke Stadium! - Steeler, Colt Tan Stars Hold Jim-crow for Downs and Will Play in Roanoke, Va." Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, July 29, 1961, pg. 24, reads: "Nine Negroes Among 22 Steeler Hopefuls - "Here, on the campus of Slippery Rock State Teachers College, Tuesday morning, the eager but cold eyes of Coach Buddy Parker were weighing the muscular symphony of 22 individual 1961 Pittsburgh Steelers' rookies, nine of whom were young men of color..."
TitMainTitle: Pittsburgh Steelers football player no. 34 Charlie Scales, holding ball on athletic field at Slippery Rock State Teachers College
CatSubject_tab: Football players--Pennsylvania--Slippery Rock.Men--Pennsylvania--Slippery Rock.Football--Pennsylvania--Slippery Rock.Pittsburgh Steelers (Football team).Slippery Rock State Teachers College.
